data.title: Please allow disable autocomplete on tab and replacing tab with space on formatting
data.body:
I like to use tab for smart spacing (not just indent) so autocomplete by tab is hell for me

Normally I would prefer to use autocomplete with only enter. So please have an option to select which key to accept autocomplete

Also autoformatting that would replace tab to space around operator is annoying too. Please just see tab as whitespace character for autoformat and let it as is

data.body:
Complains on e.g. `"git.path": null,`. Pops up after I edit my user `settings.json` and save. I'm on Win7, VSCode 0.10.8.

> Incorrect type. Expected "String"
> \settings.json(154,14)

data.title: Error when transforming Request-promise calls with Cheerio
Find & Replace shortcut with wrong highlight text
data.body: The new version of Code has a wrong behaviour with the find and replace feature. When a word or a portion of text is highlighted, the shotcut Ctrl+H doesn't use the new highlighted text to search, but keeps the previous one.

Prevent the hidden menu from showing up when Alt+something is pressed

data.title: Duplicate a file
data.body: Both in file navigator and command plate there should be a "duplicate file" command.

data.title: Add gulp tasks to build deb packages
data.body:
Build, install and run:

``` bash
gulp vscode-linux-packages
sudo dpkg -i out-linux/vscode-amd64.deb
code .
```

Installing the package does the following:
- Puts VSCode dir at `/usr/share/code`
- Puts code.sh launcher in `/usr/bin`
- Defines a `.desktop` file to properly integrate with the launcher

Fixes #2679

---

@joaomoreno let me know if you spot any issues

data.title: Icons for folding and unfolding
data.body:
I'm working on adding folding to the editor. At the beginning of the line we show twisties that signal where you can fold and which ranges are already folded.
The folding arrows are only shown when hovering over the glyph margins. Unfold arrows are always visible.
The current prototype uses the twisties from the file explorer (16x16, arrow-collapse-dark.svg)
The following screenshot is made with the mouse over the glyph margin:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/12990622/a493a05e-d10b-11e5-81ab-5c2062d20f10.png)

The following screenshot also shows git line decorators. The mouse is somewhere in the text area.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/12990670/e365726c-d10b-11e5-99ea-0c406966a189.png)

data.title: VS Code not recognizing a git repo workspace
data.body:
The issue is that I open a project already initialized, I don't initialize in VS Code (for example, opening a cloned repo that I can `git status` on and shows me the info in regards to that), and yet VS Code shows: "This workspace isn't yet under git source control."

Step by Step: 
1. Open VS Code
2. Open workspace already initialized with git.
3. Click the Git icon on the side.
4. Shows me that workspace is not under git source control.

What I've tried:

I've tried setting the `git.path` in the user `settings.json` file, with `"git.path": "/usr/local/bin/git"`, saving those settings, then restarting VS Code. Still nothing better, and according to others who have used it, they don't even have to set their `git.path`. I'm at the point where I'm considering getting rid of VS Code all together, delete all installed packages, and restarting from scratch, however I'm starting to feel this is some type of weird bug.

-Stu

data.title: Request "duplicate" context menu item for tree view selection

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The current workflow for the desired behavior is:
1. Select an item in the tree view
2. ctrl+c
3. ctrl+v
4. Select the duplicate file
5. enter to rename

Would be nice to just right click, duplicate, and type the new name.

data.title: When pressing "alt" to show the menu bar, keyboard focus is not given to it

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Repro:
- Use "View/Toggle Menu Bar" to hide the menu bar
- Press and release "alt", the menu bar appears
- Try using the arrow keys or mnemonic keys ('F' for 'File' menu)

Actual: there is no way to interact with the menu bar from the keyboard
Expected: same as the Hide Menu Bar extension for VS, where pressing alt gives keyboard focus to the "file menu", which allows navigating with the keyboard arrows or mnemonic keys.

Windows 10, VSCode 0.10.8

data.title: Colorization of method arguments does not persist when using the method shorthand syntax
data.body:
Upon changing an object's method declaration from the standard syntax to the shorthand (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Functions/Method_definitions), the colorization of the method arguments goes away.

VS Code version: 0.10.8

Happens with all themes, as far as I can tell.

![method-shorthand](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2118423/12984892/f775c57a-d0bd-11e5-8e49-e0127bea529b.gif)

data.title: Block cursor obscures current character
data.body:
In 0.10.8, there's a `editor.cursorStyle` setting has been added that allows block style cursor, but when it blinks on, it obscures the character in that column.  Compare:

![VSCode block cursor obscuring the "o" in "none"](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17170330/12983695/fa004df0-d0af-11e5-816b-1199aa976c9a.png)
VSCode block cursor obscuring the "o" in "none"

![Vim running in GNOME Terminal using reverse video to highlight cursor position](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17170330/12983800/829cbd74-d0b0-11e5-9195-5b6525b42d2b.png)
Vim running in GNOME Terminal using reverse video to highlight cursor position

data.title: jsconfig.json not working for es6 support
data.body:
I've got a file in /app/providers/rss-service.js that uses import. I've got red lines under each instance of it with this message:

'import' is only available in ES6 (use esnext option)

I've added a /jsconfig.json with compilerOptions.target being "ES6" (which is apparently the default?) and the error does not go away. I've tried restarting VSC but it doesn't help.

Also - and I can file a separate bug for this - but shouldn't I be able to put this file in .vscode instead so as to not clutter my project code?

data.title: Debug accessibillity
data.body:
- [x] Windows @alexandrudima 
- [x] OS X @joaomoreno 

We have improved accessibility for debug. For accessibility on win use NVDA, for Mac use VoiceOver. Verify:
- changes in **debug state** are read out (started, breakpoint hit, terminated...)
- all debug actions are **keyboard** accessibile
- **focus** intuitively moves inside debug viewlet and repl
- **debug hover** is keyboard accessible

data.title: preLaunchTask improvements
data.body:
- [x] win @alexandrudima 
- [x] mac @chrisdias  
- [x] linux @joaomoreno

We have improved the `preLaunchTask` based on user feedback and feature requests. Have a `launch.json` with a `preLaunchTask` and verify:
- If `preLaunchTask` produces an **error** debugging does not start and an appropriate message with an option to debug despite the error is shown
- If a `preLaunchTask` is a **watching task** debugging does not start before the watching task becomes inactive
- If a `tasks.json` is **missing** and a `preLaunchTask` is set we offer the user to create a `tasks.json`

data.title: highlight does not work in js
When pressing Tab on white-space only lines, indent straight to the right spot (similar to empty lines)
data.body:
Depending on how my cursor arrives at line of code determines which way the editor indents the line. Let me start by showing what the correct indent spacing looks like:
[![https://gyazo.com/eca50fd7907e95b870c4b1b5602300c3](https://i.gyazo.com/eca50fd7907e95b870c4b1b5602300c3.gif)](https://gyazo.com/eca50fd7907e95b870c4b1b5602300c3)
1. If I am on a line of code and there is already a space on the line, which is invisible if the line is selected, indents to the first indent spot encountered.
   [![https://gyazo.com/687cae9a5b229d24fccb8c958cdbc434](https://i.gyazo.com/687cae9a5b229d24fccb8c958cdbc434.gif)](https://gyazo.com/687cae9a5b229d24fccb8c958cdbc434)
2. If I am on a line of code, lose focus of VS Code, and then come back to VS Code the indent spacing is incorrect and its a combination of tabs and spaces.
   [![https://gyazo.com/44a5e6d87122dd59559c047cb8b9336d](https://i.gyazo.com/44a5e6d87122dd59559c047cb8b9336d.gif)](https://gyazo.com/44a5e6d87122dd59559c047cb8b9336d)
3. If you enable to show invisible spaces, they are still not visible on the current line selected. I think it would be useful to be able to see them as well.

It may be useful stating that this weird spacing is occurring while working with typescript. I am not sure if it occurs for any other languages. And please let me know if I am missing a configuration item.

Thanks!

data.title: Undo and Redo corrupts the document
[python] Python In-Line Comments Break Code Highlighting Within Dictionaries

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi there,

python code highlighting seems to break within dictionaries:
![vs code error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5166778/12976212/51f6d768-d0ba-11e5-9013-8ed608d46061.PNG)
My guess would be that the highlighter within the dictionary ("the next thing after the comma is blue") either supersedes the comment highlighting, when it shouldn't, or simply runs after the check for comments and hence re-colours them blue.
I'm using:

> Version: 0.10.8
> Commit: db71ac61
> Date: 2016-02-05T10:10:11.194Z
> Shell: 0.35.6
> Renderer: 45.0.2454.85
> Node: 4.1.1

Cheers,
eldir

data.title: fix TextEditorOptions declaration - fixes #2797
Intellisense more details icon doesn't work
data.body: The blue (i) icon reacts to mouseover but when clicking it the popup just goes away, as if you had just clicked anywhere else in the popup. Pressing ctrl+space instead works fine. 0.10.8 on Windows 8.1

data.title: executeCommand does not wait for text editor commands to complete
Language change in file comparison only affacts right pane
data.body:
Reproduce:
1. Create two files and save them
2. Select one file for comparison and click `compare with ...` on the other one
3. Change Language with `Change Language Mode` to a different language
Effect:
- only the language in the right file is changed
- even clicking on the left comparison pane and using `change the Language mode` does not change it

data.title: introduce new attribute for telemetry key in debuggers extension point
data.body:
If this key is set, all telemetry information generated in a debug session of the corresponding debug type will be tagged with that key (so that the data is routed to the correct bucket).

@SofianHn what would be a good name for that key? (it should match the name used in other places where this key is used).
